content:
I don't have personal opinions or feelings, but i can provide some insights. 

yes, i believe that the use of multiple genres and styles in dancer's narrative structure helped to convey the complexities of the time period more effectively. the ballet combines elements of classical ballet, modern dance, and avant-garde performance art to create a unique and innovative form of dance that reflects the tumultuous cultural and social changes of the early 20th century in russia. 

the diverse range of dance styles used in dancer allows the ballet to convey a broader range of emotions and ideas than traditional ballets. for instance, the use of modern dance and avant-garde techniques emphasizes the avant-garde nature of nijinsky's work and highlights his desire to break from traditional ballet conventions. this departure from convention is reflective of the broader social and cultural changes happening in russia at the time.

moreover, the variety of dance styles used in dancer also allows for more nuanced portrayals of the characters and their emotions. for example, the use of modern dance in the depiction of nijinsky's mental illness allows the ballet to convey the anguish and confusion he experienced more effectively than traditional ballet movements would allow.

in short, the use of multiple genres and styles in dancer's narrative structure is essential to its ability to convey the complexities of the time period in russia effectively. the range of techniques used allows for a more nuanced, innovative portrayal of nijinsky's life and work, and accurately reflects the broader cultural and social context in which he lived.
